entry.title: मीशो में शिकायत कैसे दर्ज करें?
entry.content: कस्टमर केयर नंबर का उपयोग करके शिपिंग के बाद मीशो पर ऑर्डर रद्द करें आप ऐप के माध्यम से मीशो पर शिप किए गए ऑर्डर को भी रद्द कर सकते हैं। शिप किए गए संदेश प्रदर्शित होने के बाद मीशो में ऑर्डर रद्द करने का तरीका इस प्रकार है: आप उनके हेल्पलाइन नंबर 91 9233~908~323 पर डायल कर सकते हैं।

entry.title: Re: New SAP Build Process Automation content for side-by-side extensions with flexible workflows
entry.content:
@SBach,

Thanks for presenting this very useful capability.   Regarding the statement "Or you include centrally managed services from SAP BTP like a Rules Service or Joule Skills into your SAP S/4HANA workﬂow project", I was wondering if the extension technique described in this blog post would be applicable for the scenario where we want to use Decisions in SAP Build Process Automation (SBPA) as a centralised dynamic agent determination engine for Flexible Workflows.  In other words, during a Flexible Workflow step, we want to pass certain parameters to SBPA Decisions and receive back the applicable agent for that step.  In this scenario, SBPA is used only for agent determination and not for any approval actions.

Any guidance you can provide would be greatly appreciated.

Regards,
Mustafa.

entry.title: Re: Dive into the future of SAP Universal ID and understand the changes underway
entry.content:
Hello @krishg,

I’m sorry to hear you’ve had difficulties logging in. At this moment users are required to log in using either their identity email addresses or individual S/P-user IDs (this is particularly applicable when multiple user IDs are registered under the same email address).

An identity switcher is currently under development and is planned to be rolled out as soon as it becomes available.

Regards,
Denis

entry.title: Compatibility of parameter login/password_max_idle_initial = 14 with SAP Kernel release 754_600
entry.content:
Hello Team

Request your confirmation with checking the compatibility of SAP APAP Parameter login/password_max_idle_initial = 14 with SAP Kernel release 754_600.

We got an EWA Alert to set this parameter as 14 and currently we have our SAP Kernel Version as 754_600 and are planning to change the same on 29th August 2025 during our supply downtime window.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Compatibility of parameter login/password_max_idle_in...
entry.content:
Dear Customer，

Regarding your question about the compatibility of the SAP profile parameter login/password_max_idle_initial = 14 with SAP Kernel release 754_600, we can confirm the following:

The parameter login/password_max_idle_initial is supported as of SAP NetWeaver 6.40 and later.
Since your kernel version is 754_600, which is significantly beyond this minimum requirement, the parameter is compatible and can be safely used in your environment.
Setting this value to 14 days is also in line with SAP EarlyWatch Alert recommendations, which aim to enforce stronger security around the validity of initial passwords.

For further details, please refer to SAP Note 862989.

Sincerely,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: ICMR Adjustment Workflow (WS78500087) – No Fiori Noti...
entry.content:
Hi @XS1M 

When an ICMR posting adjustment workflow is created, the approver should be able to receive the notification in the Fiori Launchpad. I am not sure if you are asking if the creator himself should receive it as well. If so, you need also to include the creator in the team with role "Check Variance Adjustment Posting" in Manage Teams and Responsibilities - ICMR app. See Workflow for Intercompany Variance Adjustments help documentation.

Regards,

grace

entry.title: Re: APIs for Journal Entries – The Collection(updated July, 2025)

entry.title: Re: How do I make DOX learn?
entry.content:
Hi, let me try to answer some of your questions:

Assumption: Based on your questions, it seems you are only trying the Template model in a Premium version, as you can see the Auto schemas.

1) Manual vs Auto:

Yes, a manual schema is only for the Template model, and the Auto can be a multi-model scenario depending on how you use it. On a premium instance, if you choose Auto schema, we include the Template model automatically. So, you don't really need to create a manual schema, unless you are just want to use the Template model.

Now, you can try following combination:

Auto schema + Default Extractors:

This prioritizes a pre-trained model to deliver the best results. However, if you provide feedback (correcting and confirming a document), it will switch to LLM-based extraction. If you still find the information incorrect and provide feedback again, a template will be automatically generated for you. Even after this, if you still see that the extraction is wrong, then it is likely that we have reached a limitation of the product, and it cannot be further improved. In this case, we study the issue on a case-by-case basis to determine if we can improve the extraction through backend training.

Auto Schema without Default Extractors:

In this case, we do not use any pre-trained model but use the LLM and Template model to deliver the results depending on if you provide feedback or not, as described above.

Lastly, regarding different layouts of documents: no, you can add more layouts in one Template; one Template is supposed to have only one layout of documents. The more documents you can add to provide more fields, but the layout should remain the same.

I hope it helps. thanks

entry.title: S/4HANA Cloud: Question about Application Job Exclusivity/Mutual Exclusion
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have a question regarding the exclusivity of application jobs in SAP S/4HANA  Public Cloud.

I'm aware that some standard application jobs cannot be executed simultaneously, which suggests a form of mutual exclusion or locking mechanism is in place. However, I'm trying to understand if this exclusivity applies to all application jobs or if it's limited to specific job templates.

I've been looking for official documentation to clarify this, but I'm also very interested in hearing from anyone who has experience or knowledge on this topic. Any insights from your own projects or a link to a relevant resource would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your help.

In this case, is it possible to retrieve the maximum value “2019005” and display it in the chart title?

entry.title: Re: How to find the software for download in the Software...
entry.content:
Dear customer,

entry.title: How to find out Integration scenario under the Integration & exception monitoring
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

 

We've connected several on-premise systems to the SAP Cloud ALM and configured several monitor use cases to explore the options.

 

Following the information ( Business Services Configuration) for integration & exception monitoring as part of the  Integration & Exception Monitoring - Setup & Configuration  the configuration/creation for Scenario is presented. 
Since this 'scenario' option isn't available in the config part (see printscreen) i used note DIGITS - There is no "Scenario Configuration" for possible resolution. This note also refers to the Business Services Configuration configuration without any info to create a scenario. Business Services Configuration, in my opinion is related to business service managment (BSM) ?!  so please assist in creating of viewing scenarios within the integration & exception monitoring. 
currently i have the cross topic global admin authorization and additional added the Integration Architect which should be needed due to the global admin, wright?

 

Please assist on this topic

 

Best regards,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to find out Integration scenario under the Integr...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Thanks for contacting SAP.

As what is recorded under KBA 3218867 - There is no "Scenario Configuration" section when Create Scenario for Integration & Exception Monitoring 

Integration Scenarios have been renamed to Business Services. There is no Integration Scenarios any more.

I do see you have "Business Services" under "Configuration".

A business service is a group of services and systems that represent a business scenario.

Please refer to the help page for more details regarding Business Services such as how to create or configure it.

 

Kindly feel free to let me know when further inquiries.

 

Best Regards,

Sunny

SAP Support

entry.title: Simplifying Event Configuration with the "Not Contains" Operator for Job & Automation Monitoring
entry.content:
In Q2 2025, SAP Cloud ALM introduced an impactful feature in its Job & Automation Monitoring app: the Not Contains operator for the Job/Automation Name parameter. This addition is set to streamline Event Configuration, saving administrators' valuable time and effort.

 

Why "Not Contains" Matters

Previously, administrators faced challenges when trying to exclude specific job names from events. The process involved manually entering each job name with the "is not" condition, a tedious task.

Scenario 1: One-Time Jobs

Imagine you're an administrator managing a complex customer system, where unique jobs are scheduled to run once daily. These jobs are named with a static prefix, such as "TEST," followed by a dynamic value like the current date and time. For instance, you might see job names like Test2025081201000, Test2025081301000, and so forth. As these jobs accumulate daily, managing them can become quite a task.

Previously, if you wanted to set up a generic runtime event to ignore all these unique jobs, you faced a challenge. The system didn't allow you to use a pattern-based exclusion, such as ignoring all job names containing "TEST." Instead, you had to manually enter each job name into the filter using the is not condition. This meant updating the filter every day, which was not only time-consuming but also increased the risk of errors.

Thankfully, this new feature enables a more efficient approach. By using the not contains operator for the Job/Automation Name parameter, you can easily set up a filter to ignore all jobs with names containing "TEST." This means you no longer have to manually update the filter daily, saving you time and reducing the potential for mistakes.

Scenario 2: Specific Name Patterns

Imagine a customer system where a runtime event was defined for a set of jobs with names containing the pattern "FCFS." The threshold for these jobs was set at one hour, meaning that if any job with "FCFS" in its name exceeded this runtime, an alert would be triggered. However, the customer also wanted to establish a generic runtime event with a shorter threshold of 30 minutes for all other jobs.

Previously, users faced a significant hurdle: the system did not allow them to exclude jobs with the "FCFS" pattern from the generic runtime event. The only workaround was to manually enter each job into the filter using the is not condition, which was both time-consuming and prone to errors.

With this new feature, users can now easily set up alerts for jobs that do not contain "FCFS" in their names without the need for manual entry. This enhancement not only saves time but also reduces the risk of overlooking jobs that should be excluded from the generic runtime event.

 Embrace the Change

 The Not Contains operator is designed to speed up and improve event configuration. Whether you're dealing with one-time jobs or specific name patterns, this feature reduces hassle and enhances productivity. We encourage you to explore this new tool and experience the ease it brings to your workflow.

 Feel free to share your experiences with this feature and let us know how it has impacted your event configuration tasks.

SAP Cloud ALM  #Job&AutomationMonitoring #Job&AutomationMonitoringeventconfiguration #NotContains

Expert Portal

entry.title: Re: how can I create data action step to copy version in SAC
entry.content: Not sure what's your real difficulty here. You can directly use data copy step in data action to achieve that. If you want to backup into a different version, you need to have two different data actions since one data action can only operate on target version. Then you need a multi-action to link two data actions.

entry.title: Re: ABAP2XLSX alternative in Public Cloud
entry.content:
I ended up generating the Excel file on the frontend side using JavaScript. It's surprising that SAP still doesn’t provide a proper tool for such a widely needed feature like working with Excel (in Public Cloud).

@Sandra_RossiI tried, but it’s actually not very easy to adapt ABAP2XLSX for Public Cloud. There are many restrictions—some classes and data types aren’t supported in Public Cloud. This leads to cascading errors like 'XXX is not permitted,' which then forces you to create your own Z-version of the object.

entry.title: SAP Stammtisch Brisbane - “Tech & Beach Vibes – SAP in the Sun”
entry.content:
You are invited!!

Escape the dashboards and dive into island vibes with Brisbane’s SAP community. This month, we’re mixing business with beachside banter - no powerpoints, no suits, just smart minds and good times.

🎟️ Cost: Free – just bring your best SAP story and a thirst for connection

Theme: Tech & Beach Vibes
We’re celebrating the systems that keep things moving - and the people who make them sing. Expect laid-back networking, unexpected insights, and maybe a pineapple garnish or two.

Why Attend?

  • Meet fellow SAP pros, platform nerds, newbies to SAP and transformation trailblazers
  • Swap stories, share wins, and laugh about the bugs that got away
  • No pressure. No pitches. Just real talk and real people

Dress Code: Tropical flair encouraged—think florals, linen, or your best tropical vibes🌺

NOTE - if you cannot find us - please check with the concierge or look for the blow up palm tree.

entry.title: 404 on /samlsinglesignon/saml/SSO in Hybris SAML SSO setup
entry.content:
I am trying to enable SAML SSO for the storefront in SAP Commerce 2211.41. (Not Spartacus site) 

I am implementing SAML SSO in SAP Commerce (Hybris) using the samlsinglesignon extension.
I have added the extension in localextensions.xml and configured local.properties (entityId, metadata, keystore, etc.).

I also created a SAMLController with /samlsinglesignon/ssologin that redirects to /samlsinglesignon/saml/SSO.

When I hit /samlsinglesignon/ssologin, it redirects correctly to /samlsinglesignon/saml/SSO, but that request returns 404 Not Found.

My suspicion is that the Spring Security filter chain for /samlsinglesignon/** is not active in my storefront.

What exactly needs to be added in the storefront’s *-spring.xml or *-security-spring.xml to register the SAML filters (samlFilter, samlEntryPoint, etc.) from the samlsinglesignon extension, so that /samlsinglesignon/saml/SSO is handled by the SAML stack instead of returning 404?

Also, do we need to explicitly import classpath:/samlsinglesignon/spring/security-saml.xml into the storefront context?

Can you guide me to resolve my issue? 

Reference snippet : 

@Controller
@RequestMapping("/samlsinglesignon")
public class SAMLController {
    @RequestMapping(value = "/ssologin", method = RequestMethod.GET)
    public void startSsoLogin(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response) throws IOException {
        response.sendRedirect(request.getContextPath() + "/samlsinglesignon/saml/SSO");
    }

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: (Re)using Master Operations in SAP Digital Manufacturing
entry.content:
Hi @ManoelCosta and @michael_koerner3 ,

I'm testing the transfer of the field SAP ME Operation Data from routings into production orders in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and the expected result is that the field SAP ME Operation Data should be automatically copied from the routing into the order operation, however the field remains blank in the production order operation, causing an impact.

This breaks integration with SAP Digital Manufacturing, since operation mapping cannot be identified without the SAP ME Operation Data reference. 

I've maintained the value for this field in my routing, also production version exists referencing this routing and BOM.

So, can you please confirm whether:

  • SAP ME Operation Data is supported for automatic transfer in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • If yes, advise on corrective action or apply a fix.
  • If no, confirm if this is a product limitation for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. In the meantime, I'm currently working with a workaround in DM with production processes.

Thank you for your support.

Cheers,
Bruno

entry.title: Re: Rebates
entry.content:
From the screen shot of the error message which you shared, and to brief you why VBOF shows “No Correction Due to Value Change”, is because, this message typically appears when:

  • the pricing procedure has changed after the billing document was created.
  • A rebate-relevant condition type (like Z209) was removed, marked statistical, or excluded.
  • VBOF compares the current pricing procedure with the one used during billing — and if the condition is missing, it assumes no correction is needed.

In your case, invoices created before June 2024 used Z209, but the current pricing procedure no longer includes it — so VBOF skips accrual updates.

SAP Notes 1498158 and 1023925 explain that VBOF won’t update billing documents if the pricing procedure has changed in a way that affects rebate conditions. VBOF relies on program SDBONT06, which compares old and new pricing conditions. If Z209 is missing in the current config, it won’t trigger an update.

Below are couple of options to rectify the issue

Option 1: Temporarily Reintroduce Z209 in Pricing Procedure
Revert the pricing procedure to include Z209 (even if inactive or statistical). Run VBOF again for rebate agreement 31286. Once accruals are updated, you can remove Z209 again. This is the least disruptive and most SAP-aligned solution.

Option 2: Use Debugging to Identify Condition Mismatch
Set a breakpoint in program SDBONT06 at PERFORM bonus_ermitteln CHANGING rc. Compare internal tables xKOMV (after pricing update) and oKOMV (before update). This will confirm that Z209 is missing and why VBOF skips the update. This helps validate your diagnosis and can be useful if you escalate to SAP support.

Option 3: Manual Accrual Posting
If reverting config is not feasible, consider manual accrual posting via FI or SD adjustment. This is not ideal but may be necessary if invoices cannot be canceled or reprocessed.

In short, the summary is

entry.title: Re: ILM Archiving of EPPM projects
entry.content:
Hello Francisco, If you are using Rule generator to create ILM business rule and then ILM retention rules, you could get this error.

Instead, follow these steps. 

1. Assign ILM object to an audit area. 

2. Create a live retention policy with retention rules in this audit area. 

3. Schedule archiving process. 

Following these steps, it should execute archiving process and results will be available in the logs accessible via Monitory Archiving jobs fiori app. 

ILM residence rules are optional. 

Hope this helps. 

If you still face an error, get back with the exact error message details. 

Regards,
Revathi
